intro: Glyphaea grewioides, commonly known as the mountain orchid, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in dense clusters. Glyphaea grewioides thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
